meanings.definition: Showing deep-seated resentment or ill will
meanings.sent1: Her rancorous glare made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The rancorous argument between the siblings lasted for hours.
meanings.sent3: The rancorous cat refused to share its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The rancorous storm clouds loomed ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The rancorous tone in his voice revealed his true feelings.

meanings.sent1: The rancorous letter was filled with harsh words.
meanings.sent2: Their rancorous rivalry was known throughout the town.
meanings.sent3: The rancorous old man grumbled about the noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The rancorous taste of the medicine lingered in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The rancorous expression on her face showed her displeasure.
